ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Has the z-axis bug been fixed?
ygData.msgSnippet: I ll risk it.  I ll try doing Denon s outside a merchant hut and run like hell most likely.  Heck, I ll even try it from on top of the merchant hut. Kit ...
ygData.messageBody:
I'll risk it. I'll try doing Denon's outside a merchant hut and run like
hell most likely. Heck, I'll even try it from on top of the merchant hut.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Reece, Tom CPT- 25IDL G4
[mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2000 7:24 PM
To: EQBards
Subject: [eqbards] Has the z-axis bug been fixed?


There is a current topic on the Concert Hall board discussing the use of AE
songs (CoD, DDD) in dungeons. Andres Tal, who is the bard rep for EQ
Casters and a reputable poster, stated that AE songs shouldn't aggo through
walls/floors any more due to a recent fix/patch. There has to be a line of
sight between you and the mob for these songs to cause damage. If this is
the case, then it would indicate our AE songs are no longer affected by the
z-axis bug. Not certain I really want to test it though to confirm if he is
correct:-)
Here is the URL:
http://pub5.ezboard.com/ftheconcerthallbackstage.showMessage?topicID=3770.to
pic
Galtin of E'ci
